prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. Step 1: Creating the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.2537, 0.0) Step 2: Drawing the 2D Sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Step 3: Creating the Sketch Entities * Line 1: Begin at (0.0, 0.0) and end at (0.6426, 0.0) * Line 2: Begin at (0.6426, 0.0) and end at (0.6426, 0.4228) * Line 3: Begin at (0.6426, 0.4228) and end at (0.0, 0.4228) * Line 4: Begin at (0.0, 0.4228) and end at (0.0, 0.0) Step 4: Closing the Loop Connect line 1 to line 4 to form a closed loop. Step 5: Scaling the Sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6426. Step 6: Transforming the Sketch to 3D Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Step 7: Extruding the Sketch Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.2537 units in the normal direction. This will create the three-dimensional rectangular prism. Step 8: Describing the Part The part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.6426 units * Width: 0.2537 units * Height: 0.6426 units The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The part is created using a 'New Body Feature Operation'.</description>
